Description: Foot and wall sherd of Attic black-glazed pottery fish-plate; tall, flaring, ring foot with groove at junction with bowl inside and out; on floor, round central depression, with groove on its outer edge; glazed black (peeled in parts) save for the grooves, the resting surface, on which there are two lines, and nthe centre of the underside, part-preserved; inscription cut on underside; drill hole on broken edge of foot for analysis.
Curator's comments: Clay analysed by M. Hughes and found to be Attic: G. Harbottle, M.J. Hughes and S. Seleem, 'The origin of black-figure Greek ceramics found in Naucratis (Nile Delta)', Archaeometry 47 (2005), 511-518; p. 513, table 1, no.24
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. XXXIV, no. 509)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 673, no. 317)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1887)
